alert.note: Alert for City of Williamsburg; James City; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Williamsburg, James City and York. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected in portions of the advisory area during the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Williamsburg, College Of William And Mary, Norge, Queens Lake, Toano, Kings Point, York Terrace, Jamestown, Carver Gardens, Busch Gardens, Grove, Ewell, Lightfoot, Oaktree, Centerville, Skimino, Barlows Corner, Williamsburg Airport and Camp Peary. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Williamsburg; James City; York
